title: Shaw ISP Disconnects in My Game
body: Earlier today, I played in a game in which two of my team mates had Shaw ISP. Both were dc'ing at the same times. One of those times was when we were doing baron lol. Anyway, is there a way to get a loss prevented for this? They probably dc'd a total of like 15-20 times, for just a minute or so. Shaw ISP.

replies.body: Nope, I haven't seen since saturday morning. ~36 hours ago
is it still happening for you guys?
Had the same issue today. It was shaw. Lemme guess. Alberta?

A friend and I were having the same problems and noticed that Reddit also started timing out during the ~30s disconnects. It probably something with one of the peering links.

I don't have enough screen space to start doing ping tests to all the IP's the LoL client is connecting to, is there a gateway or 2 we can use for testing?

While I *have* been seeing a few different reports of issues on Shaw ISP, we can still at least do some basic troubleshooting to make sure the main issue isn't somewhere in your own network first. Let's go ahead and run some tests using this [**connection guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues).

Pay close attention to port forwarding and how to flush your DNS, but be sure to go through all of the steps just in case. Let me know how that turns out!
